title: Factory reset with broken power button? (Android cannot start, your data may be corrupted)
content:
I have a Google Pixel with the latest version of Android released to it. Yesterday I tried to restart it because it froze, and it got stuck for around 30 minutes in the boot screen, and after that, each time I try to turn it on a screen that says the following shows up:
"Android cannot start, your data may be corrupted..."

That screens lets me choose between trying again (to boot, that is), and factory resetting. The problem is I can't pick any of those options because the power button doesn't work at all.
I manage to turn on the phone by waiting for it to discharge, and then holding volume up right before plugging the charger in. I can get into recovery mode as well using this method.
Is there a way I can get my phone working back again? If the factory reset can be avoided is great, but I'll be okay if I have to do it. I just want my phone back.

Worth noting, my phone has been crashing randomly the last 2 weeks, eversince I mass updated most of my apps. I tried to solved this issue by upgrading from Android 9 to 10, but it didn't solve anything. The problem had stopped showing up a few days ago, until the last time I tried to restart the phone.
